headline.main: FOOD MAKERS TOLD TO SELL NUTRITION; Grocery Manufacturers at Convention Hear Plea for Emphasis on Health

docs.lead_paragraph: The food processing industry was warned yesterday by a leading nutritionist that the American public was "awakening to the importance of nutrition that comes in those pretty packages" containing food products.
docs.snippet: The food processing industry was warned yesterday by a leading nutritionist that the American public was "awakening to the importance of nutrition that comes in those pretty packages" containing food products.

headline.main: NEW CLUES FOUND TO HEART DISEASE; Diet, Smoking and Too Little Exercise Linked in Data Given at Health Parley

byline.original: By JOHN A. OSMUNDSENSpecial to The New York Times

docs.abstract: conf hears some new evidence linking diet, smoking and lack of exercise to heart disease; details; Assn Blakeslee and Lasker Awards presented
docs.lead_paragraph: ST. LOUIS, Oct. 23 -- New evidence that diet, smoking, and too little exercise can lead to heart disease has come from studies of railroad workers and Negro and white employes of a gas company, it was reported here today.
docs.snippet: ST. LOUIS, Oct. 23 -- New evidence that diet, smoking, and too little exercise can lead to heart disease has come from studies of railroad workers and Negro and white employes of a gas company, it was reported here today.
